lead_paragraph: BRAMLET--Bryan Charles. Born in Manhattan, July 16, 1963 to Roland Charles Bramlet and Joann Atterberry Bramlet, passed February 7, 2016 in the Mustang region of Nepal of natural causes after a day of trekking with friends. This was one of many trips to the Himalayas Bryan loved. Bryan was also a huge fan of the NFL and the Denver Broncos specifically. He was looking forward to watching the big game on his return. Bryan attended Ithaca high school and was a graduate of the University of Colorado. He made a home in Kaohsiung, Taiwan for the last 20 years where he met the love of his life, Sherrie Huang Bramlet. They had two beautiful children together, Traverse (13) and Alanis (11). In Taiwan Bryan found a passion for teaching and established and taught in his English language school, The Cayuga Academy. Bryan had an adventurous, free spirited, warm nature, a sharp mind and a frequent large smile. He enjoyed life fully. Bryan will be greatly missed by his family, many friends, and many current and former students. We love you Bryan. Bryan is survived by his wife Sherrie, children Traverse, Alanis, father Roland Bramlet, sister Nancy Henry and family and brother Steven Bramlet and family. Memorial services will be conducted in Kaohsiung, Taiwan and at the Bramlet family cemetery, Wallowa, Oregon. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  BRAMLET, BRYAN CHARLES
